metadata.Title: CVE-2019-15297 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
res_pjsip_t38 in Sangoma Asterisk 13.21-cert4, 15.7.3, and 16.5.0 allows an attacker to trigger a crash by sending a declined stream in a response to a T.38 re-invite initiated by Asterisk.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-15297` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

asterisk - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-config - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-dahdi - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-mobile - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-modules - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-mp3 - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-mysql - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-ooh323 - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-tests - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-voicemail - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-voicemail-imapstorage - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-voicemail-odbcstorage - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-vpb - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: asterisk package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:16.10.0~dfsg-1').
